greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers k such that 1/(Sum_{p|k} (1/p) - 1), where p are the prime divisors of k, is a positive integer.
comment: Sequence is generated by A007850(n). For example: 30, 858, 1722 (30 = 2*3*5, 858 = 2*3*11*13, 1722 = 2*3*11*13) generate numbers of the form 2^a*3^b*5^c, 2^a*3^b*7^c*41^d, 2^a*3^b*11^c*13^d, (a,b,c,d => 1), which are in the sequence.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4233 (terms below 10^10)
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 28 2002
